We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of pinpoint pupils and difficulty breathing suggest opioid overdose. The drug administered by first responders is likely naloxone, which is a pure mu receptor antagonist and works by reversing the effects of the opioids. Option (A) is incorrect as kappa receptor agonists produce sedation and analgesia but can also cause hallucinations and dysphoria. Option (B) is incorrect as alpha 2 receptor agonists are used to treat hypertension and anxiety. Option (D) is incorrect as delta receptor antagonists are not used in the treatment of opioid overdose.

Option A (Kappa receptor pure agonist) and Option B (Alpha 2 receptor agonist) are not used in opioid overdose treatment, and Option D (Delta receptor antagonist) is also not a commonly used option.
